result.execSummary:
All charges against Jesus Martinez-Agustin in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesus Martinez-Agustin is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Martinez-Agustin

records.addlTxt: of counsel Atty Jeremiah Harrelson. eif

02:07 PM  CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel.   ADA:  Erica Ellenwood in person. DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson in person.  DF:  Jesus Martinez-Agustin appeared in person. Monica M, Interpreter, in person. INCLUDES:  14CF272 and 14CF362 both set for PLEAS.  Interpreter sworn. Atty Harrelson states agreement on record. ADA Ellenwood agrees. Atty Harrelson reviewed Spanish plea questionnaire with the DE; Ms Marin helped as well. Atty Harrelson files plea questionnaire. State is in compliance with witness notification. S/T of DE. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF272. Court questions Defendant. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty in Ct 1 in 14CF272. Court dismisses Cts 2 and 3 in 14CF272 and dismisses 14CF362 in its entirety. Sentencing arguments. Court Orders: 

S/W -  30 months probation 
-  Imposes 100 day conditional jail time ; for commence immediately - 1st 48 hrs in St Croix County. Released for work then serve balance in Barron County. 
- 6 days credit for time served
-Credit for good time
-Work release approved as authorized by the jail 
- May serve in Barron County with no additional expense to St Croix County
- Alcohol and Drug Assessment 
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- 4 year revocation with credit for adminstrative suspension
- 4 year IID
- Court Costs: $ 268.00  Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
- Minimum Fines of $1200; Interlock surcharge, and other costs to be determined and bond applied. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 18, 2020 at 02:00 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF272 & 14CF362 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jesus Martinez-Agustin appeared. Interpreter Monica Marin present. Case called at 2:57 p.m. Court notes these matters are set for a pre trial conference. Off record, matters were set for plea and sentencing. DA Nieskes will be working remotely at that time. Requesting to appear remotely. Court approves.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2020 at 02:00 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF272 & 14CF362 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jesus  Martinez-Agustin appeared. Interpreter Mariana Kralewski. Case called at 3:57 p.m. Oath of Interpreter given at 3:57 p.m. Atty Harrelson requesting blood results. DA Nieskes sees there was a blood draw done. Will need a day or two to track it down. Court will set for another hearing. Also received a note from DRC for a modification in testing. No violations have been reported. State gives bond argument. Court will amend bond. DE may return testing device to DRC today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2020 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 27, 2020 at 02:45 pm.

* AMENDED *
Includes 14CF362 and 14CF272

BOND ON FILE 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
Pre-trial conference on September 22, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

04:07 PM  CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jesus  Martinez-Agustin appeared. Interpreter Maria M. in Court. Includes 14CF362 and 14CF272. Attys request to reset matter to allow for offer to be conveyed by State. Court sets PTC. Interpreter confirms that herself or Monica will be available for the next hearing date.  gll  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2020 at 03:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 22, 2020 at 03:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 6, 2020 at 04:00 pm.

10:16 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel.  ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson via zoom  with  Jesus  Martinez-Agustin appeared by zoom.  Interpreter M Marin appeared via zoom. INCLUDES 14CF272 and 14CF362.  Interpreter sworn.  Atty Harrelson states he has received the information filed on both cases. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  DE pleads NG on all charges in both 14CF272 and 14CF362. Waives speedy trial. Court confirms address of DE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2020 at 04:00 pm.

08:52 AM   Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: A Anderson,ADA:  Patrick J Leigl   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jesus Martinez-Agustin appeared.  M Marin interpreter.
